title: Business Strategy Practical Skill Enhancement: Problem-Based Learning for Solving Hospitality Tourism Field Issues

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for corporate management/HR/administrative staff

learning_goals: Analysis of complex problems occurring in actual tourism settings using a PBL framework and proposal of at least three solution strategies
Design of ethical decision-making processes considering perspectives of diverse stakeholders (tourists, local residents, businesses)

Learners can analyze two real-world field problems (e.g., customer complaint cases) using the SERVQUAL service quality model from hospitality theory, and create a 5–7-minute oral presentation and a 3–5-page report with improvement strategies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
